intro: Polemonium nevadense, commonly known as the Sierra penstemon, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem.
